_exec_summary.SummaryText:
A process hazards analysis (PHA) was conducted on an ammonia refrigeration system for McLane Company's new facility  at 7600 W. Roosevelt St., in Phoenix on November 23, 2015 . This is a new facility, with construction in still in progress,  and does not yet have ammonia on site.
 
 The objective of the study was to identify potential catastrophic incidents by addressing Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) requirements for compliance PHAs.
 
The PHA was based on a generic study developed by the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration (IIAR) and the International Association of Refrigerated Warehouses (IARW). The generic study was customized and supplemented with unique site‑specific issues to ensure that all hazards of this particular ammonia refrigeration system were thoroughly reviewed. This was done with a qualified PHA leader in a team format, centered around the What‑If/Checklist technique.
 
A number of recommendations were made concerning items revealed during the study which are summarized the the attached  PHA Recommendation Summary

Refrigeration System Basis of Design & Life Safety Systems Sequence of Operations:

THIS AMMONIA REFRIGERATION SYSTEM AS INSTALLED WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THESE PLANS IS OF THE CLOSED LOOP TWO STAGE - VAPOR COMPRESSION CYCLE TYPE WITH MAXIMUM DESIGN OPERATING PRESSURE OF 300 P.S.I.G.

NOTE - THE ENTIRE SYSTEM IS AUTOMATICALLY SEQUENCED & MONITORED INCLUDING THE AMMONIA LEAK DETECTION / NOTIFICATION CODE REQUIRED FUNCTION BY A PLC (PROCESS LOGIC CONTROLLER) BASED SYSTEM WITH:
ALARM / FAILURE NOTIFICATION FUNCTIONALITY & REMOTE ACCESS

ELECTRICAL POWER TO THE PLC CONTROLLER / AMMONIA DETECTION & NOTIFICATION SYSTEM IS SUPPLIED BY A DESIGNATED PRIMARY CIRCUIT BREAKER TO BE LOCKED ON WITH A 4 HOUR UN-INTERUPTABLE POWER SUPPLY (UPS) BATTERY BACK-UP IN THE EVENT PRIMARY ELECTRICAL POWER IS LOST.

NORMAL SYSTEM OPERATION:
1ST STAGE PRESSURE LEVEL:  LOW TEMPERATURE SUCTIO

N LEVELS
	OPERATING AT: 1.6 PSIG & -30 DEGREES F
		3.6 PSIG & -20 DEGREES F
2ND STAGE PRESSURE LEVEL: MEDIUM TEMPERATURE SUCTION LEVELS
	OPERATING AT:	35 PSIG & +20 DEGREES F
DISCHARGE PRESSURE LEVEL
	OPERATING AT:	165.9 PSIG & +90 DEGREES F

THIS SYSTEM IS PER CODE AND IS EQUIPPED WITH:
EMERGENCY STOP SWITCH'S LOCATED AT THE EXTERIOR & INTERIOR OF THE MECHANICAL ROOM EXTERIOR ACCESS / EGRESS DOOR & THE FRONT OF THE RCP (REFRIGERATION CONTROL PANEL) WHICH WILL STOP THE SYSTEM FROM OPERATION IF ACTUATED / OPERATED & INITIATE SYSTEM FAILURE ALARM OUTPUTS.

AUTOMATIC LIQUID & HOT GAS KING SOLENOID VALVES WHICH UPON DE-ENERGIZING (DE-ACTIVATING) WILL STOP THE FLOW OF HIGH PRESSURE AMMONIA TO THE FACILITY FROM THE HIGH PRESSURE SIDE OF THE SYSTEM TO THE REST OF THE SYSTEM & SPACES

EMERGENCY EQUALIZATION CONTROL VALVE STATION WHICH WILL BE ACTIVATED UPON SENSING OPERATING PRESSURES OF: 255 P.S.I.G.
(15% DROP OF THE 300 P.S.I.G.) DESIGN MAXIMUM OPERATING PRESSURE)

	ACTIVATION OF THIS AUTOMATIC PRESSURE EQUALIZATION SYSTEM WILL:
	AUTOMATICALLY STOP THE SYSTEM (INCLUDING KING SOLENOIDS DEACTIVATION)
	& REDUCE EXCESS SYSTEM PRESSURES BY - INTERNALLY RELIEVING (CASCADING) THE 
	OVERPRESSURIZED PORTION OF THE SYSTEM FROM UPPER SYSTEM PRESSURE LEVELS
	TO THE NEXT LOWER SYSTEM PRESSURE LEVEL

OVER PRESSURIZATION SAFETY RELIEF VALVES WITH THEIR DISCHARGES PIPED TO A COMMON DISCHARGE HEADER LEADING TO A WATER DIFFUSION TANK DESIGNED TO ABSORB THE DISCHARGED AMMONIA AT THE RATE PRESCRIBED BY CODE

CONTINUOUS AMMONIA DETECTION SENSORS LOCATED IN AREAS NEAR EQUIPMENT & WHERE THE PROBABILITY OF AN AMMONIA RELEASE COULD OCCUR WITH AUDIBLE / VISUAL NOTIFICATION

	OPERATION OF THE AMMONIA DETECTION SYSTEM IS AS FOLLOWS:
	REFRIGERATED SPACES:
	A)	IF AMMONIA IS DETECTED AT THE 25 PPM TLV-TWA LEVEL
	     1)	ACTIVATE HORN & STROBE ALARMS IN ALL REFRIGERATED SPACES
	     2)	PROVIDE ALARM TO OFF-SITE MONITIRING COMPANY TO NOTIFY THE FIRE 
		DEPART

MENT & SERVICING CONTRACTOR VIA 911 RESPONSE MANAGEMENT
	B)	IF AMMONIA IS DETECTED AT 150 PPM = 50% OF IDLH (IMMEDIATELY
		DANGEROUS TO LIFE & HEALTH) AMMONIA CONCENTRATION LEVEL
		(IN ADDITION TO THE ABOVE)
	     1)	SHUT-OFF LIQUID SOLENOIDS TO THE AIR HANDLING UNITS MONITORED BY 		THE LEAK DETECTION ZONE IN ALARM
	MECHANICAL ROOM:
	A)	IF AMMONIA IS DETECTED AT THE 25 PPM TLV-TWA LEVEL
	     1)	ACTIVATE HORN & STROBES IN THE MECHANICAL ROOM
	     2)	ACTIVATE HORN & STROBE ALARMS LOCATED AT EACH ENTRANCE TO THE 
		MECHANICAL ROOM
	     3)	ACTIVATE EMERGENCY PURGE VENTILATION
	     4)	PROVIDE ALARM TO OFF-SITE MONITORING COMPANYTO NOTIFY THE FIRE
		DEPARTMENT & SERVICING CONTRACTOR VIA 911 RESPONSE MANAGEMENT
	B)	IF AMMONIA IS DETECTED AT 300 PPM = IDLH (IMMEDIATELY DANGEROUS
		TO LIFE AND HEALTH) AMMONIA CONCENTRATION LEVEL
		(IN ADDITION TO THE ABOVE)
	     1)	SHUT DOWN MECHANICAL ROOM EQUIPMENT INCLUDING:
		- COMPRESSORS (ALL)
		- CONDENSERS (ALL)
		- VESSELS (ALL)
		- AIR UNIT ZONES (ALL)
		- LIQUID & HOT GAS AUTOMATIC KING SOLENOIDS FEEDING HIGH PRESSURE
		AMMONIA TO THE SYSTEM (ALL)


THE COMPRESSOR ROOM VENTILATION IS DESIGNED TO AUTOMATICALLY MAINTAIN THE ROOM BELOW THE LEL (LOWER EXPLOSIVE LIMIT) OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA BASED ON ROOM DIMENSIONS AND AMMONIA INVENTORY QUANTITY

THE COMPRESSOR ROOM IS DESIGNED TO AUTOMATICALLY DE-ENERGIZE ALL SPARK GENERATING ELECTRICAL EQUIPMENT BELOW THE LEL (LOWER EXPLOSIVE LIMIT) THROUGH SHUNT TRIP OF ACTIVATION OF THE MAIN BREAKERS SUPPLYING ELECTRICAL POWER TO EQUIPMENT LOCATED IN THE MECHANICAL ROOM
